intro: Notanthera lanceolatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf notanthera, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Notanthera lanceolatus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
